author: Primicias
title: Diputados opositores en Argentina dejan debate del proyecto de Milei por incidentes
text:
Proyecto de 'ley ómnibus' impulsada por el Gobierno de Javier Milei genera tensiones dentro y fuera del Congreso de Argentina.
Diputados opositores en Argentina abandonaron este jueves, 1 de febrero de 2024, el recinto de la Cámara Baja donde
se debate la denominada 'ley ómnibus' impulsada por el Gobierno de Javier Milei. Esto, tras fracasar en su intento de pasar a un receso en la sesión ante la represión a manifestantes a las puertas del Congreso.
Varios parlamentarios de izquierda y del frente peronista Unión por la Patria salieron del palacio legislativo para dirigirse hacia el inmenso cordón policial desplegado por orden del Ministerio de Seguridad de Argentina para impedir que los manifestantes bloqueasen calles en su protesta en contra del proyecto de ley.
Después de una media hora fuera del recinto, regresaron a sus escaños para continuar con la actividad legislativa.
Los diputados salieron a la calle después de intentar sin éxito someter a votación una moción para pasar a un cuarto intermedio (receso) en la sesión del pleno ante los incidentes entre las fuerzas de seguridad y los manifestantes, miembros de organizaciones políticas y sociales, principalmente de izquierda.
El pedido fue formalizado en el recinto por Germán Martínez, presidente del bloque de Unión por la Patria, quien refirió que varios diputados habían recibido mensajes e imágenes de la "terrible represión" a las puertas del Congreso.
El pedido de pasar a un cuarto intermedio fue sometido a votación a mano alzada y rechazada, tras lo cual varios opositores abandonaron sus bancas y salieron a la calle.
Una vez frente al cordón policial, exigieron que el Ministerio de Seguridad ordenase el retiro de los efectivos.
"En este momento, que se viven cuestiones delicadas fuera del Congreso, es importante que recordemos que los problemas no se arreglan con más problemas, como claramente aquellos que se levantaron están queriendo generar", dijo el diputado Hernán Treffinger, de la formación gobernante La Libertad Avanza (ultraderecha).
Los enfrentamientos entre la Policía y los manifestantes ya se habían registrado este miércoles, en la primera jornada de debate en la Cámara de Diputados de la 'ley ómnibus' impulsada por Milei y que incluye múltiples medidas, principalmente orientadas a la desregulación de la economía.

author: VEJA RIO
title: Radar de delícias tem Sudbrack no Bar de Sto António e domingueira no Libô
text:
Sardinhas no Bar de Sto António
Um “sardinhada” de primeira ocorrerá nesta quinta (23), das 18h às 22h, na calçada do Bar de Sto António, na Rua Humberto de Campos, no Leblon. Conduzida pelo anfitrião, o chef Alexandre Henriques, que cozinhará ao lado de sua mãe Dona Henriqueta, a primeira edição do evento terá como convidada a chef Roberta Sudbrack, e o menu apresenta receitas para petiscar cheias de criatividade e técnica.
+ Começa a temporada de feijoadas pré-Carnaval no Rio. Confira a agenda
Entre as opções estão Sardinhas na grelha (R$ 19,00 a unidade); as Sardinhas à lagareiro (R$ 45,00, duas unidades); Sardinha à Sto António (R$ 45,00, duas unidades); e Sardinha à Roberta (R$ 45,00, duas unidades). Para beber há sugestões como o vinho verde Regueiro Trajadura Alvarinho – Monção e Melgaço (R$ 35,00 a taça, e R$ 156,00 a garrafa) e o drinque Quinta do Cajueiro (R$ 36,00) feito com Porto Tawny, caju, limão siciliano, amaro e tônica.
Rua Humberto de Campos, 827-B, Leblon.
Compartilhe essa matéria via: Continua após a publicidade Bar de Sto António: Roberta Sudbrack entre Alexandre e Henriqueta (./Divulgação) Libô recebe Gavinho
O bar de vinhos Libô está organizando uma série de eventos de domingo em sua charmosa adega subterrânea, e neste dia 26 a casa recebe os especialistas e importadores Alain Inglês e Eduardo May, da Gavinho, para uma tarde de degustação e bate papo. O evento ocorre das 14h às 18h, e contará com rótulos de produção orgânica e feitos com leveduras indígenas, vinhos “naturais” de alta qualidade como os franceses Domaine Calvez Bobinet Piak! Blanc, e o tinto Domaine Calvez Bobinet Aunis, além do laranja espanhol Celler La Salada Disbarats.
Rua Conde de Irajá, 90, Botafogo.
Novos drinques no Jappa da Quitanda
Restaurantes japoneses investem cada vez mais em coquetelaria, e o Jappa da Quitanda tem carta nova para o verão. O Shissô Spritz (R$ 37,00) leva cachaça, cordial de maçã verde, shissô e espumante. E o Mania De Você (R$ 35,00) vai de rum, xarope de morango com hibisco e pimenta rosa, hortelã e água com gás perfumada com flor de laranjeira. Entre outros, o Erva Venenosa (R$ 36,00) é preparado com shochu de cevada, uva verde, açúcar e limão.
Loja de Ipanema na Rua Barão da Torre, 422. Mais quatro endereços.
Continua após a publicidade Koral: restaurante ganhou mesas externas com mais 20 lugares (Yasmin Alves/Divulgação) Koral ampliado
Um dos destaques da aquecida gastronomia do bairro de Ipanema, o restaurante Koral, do chef Pedro Coronha, amplia seus domínios e horários de funcionamento. A casa ganhou mesas na calçada, entre vasos de plantas, com 20 novos lugares, e passa a abrir às segundas-feiras, de 19h às 23h. Conhecido pelo cardápio descontraído e contemporâneo, e pelo ótimo menu executivo que está sempre apresentando novidades, o restaurante ganhou o prêmio de melhor sobremesa no VEJA RIO COMER & BEBER 2024.
Rua Barão da Torre, 446, Ipanema.
Receba gratuitamente as melhores dicas de programação cultural no Rio. Inscreva-se aqui para receber a nossa newsletter Aceito receber ofertas produtos e serviços do Grupo Abril. Cadastro efetuado com sucesso! Você receberá nossas newsletters pela manhã de segunda a sexta-feira.

author: Stephanie Giang-Paunon
title: Leah Remini, husband Angelo Pagán filing for divorce after 21 years: 'Unknown territory' | Fox News
text: Leah Remini and Angelo Pagán have decided to call it quits after 21 years of marriage. The former couple shared a joint statement on social media and detailed the reasons they’re getting a divorce. "Well, here we are. After 28 years together and 21 years of marriage, we have decided to file for divorce," the lengthy Instagram post began. LEAH REMINI SENDS DAUGHTER SOFIA TO COLLEGE WITH A 'BITTERSWEET' GOODBYE: 'THE HARDEST THING I HAVE EVER DONE' Leah Remini and her husband Angelo Pagán publicly shared that they are parting ways after 21 years of marriage. (Getty Images) "This decision came after a lot of thought and care, and as hard as divorce is, we are approaching this with a positive outlook because we know it’s what’s best for us. We are proud of how we have worked through this together."The couple accompanied their statement with a throwback photo next to a picture of themselves in the present day. "Yes, we’re sad, and we’ve got some figuring out to do as we continue to move forward into our new normal—together still in many ways, and apart in some new ones," the post continued. Remini and Pagán are filing for divorce after more than two decades of marriage. Despite being "best friends" for many years and still gathering as a family, the pair listed reasons why they have decided to part ways. APP USERS CLICK HERE TO VIEW POST "To put it simply, we both changed, as people do, and we got used to playing roles that didn’t fit us anymore. After a lot of effort and consideration, we’ve decided to take this step, which reflects who we are today," they added. LEAH REMINI DISAGREES WITH HOW LAURA PREPON LEFT SCIENTOLOGY: ‘NOT EVERYBODY WHO HAS A VOICE USES IT’ "Our bond is still strong—it’s just evolved into something different. We think a marriage that lasted this long and created so many beautiful memories, especially raising our incredible daughter, is something to celebrate." Remini has been acting for decades, but is also known for vocally opposing Scientology since leaving the church in 2013. (Jesse Grant) LIKE WHAT YOU’RE READING? CLICK HERE FOR MORE ENTERTAINMENT NEWS The post referred to their daughter, Sofia Bella . Remini and Pagán welcomed Sofia on June 16, 2004. Pagán has three additional sons from a previous relationship."From our perspective, this marriage was a huge success," the statement continued. "And now, we’re looking forward to creating even more cherished moments—just in a different way."Remini and Pagán explained they wanted to be as "transparent" as possible, since their marriage had been in the public eye for years. The two actors were featured in special projects that aired on VH1 and had a reality show, "Leah Remini: It’s All Relative," that ran for two seasons on TLC from 2014-15."We are sharing this unknown territory with you all as we take our first steps into this next stage of our lives publicly," the couple said. Pagán guest stars as Hector on Remini's "The King of Queens." (Getty Images) CLICK HERE TO SIGN UP FOR THE ENTERTAINMENT NEWSLETTER They added that they want people to "have more access to different kinds of relationship stories and not feel so isolated in navigating the changes that millions of couples make every year.""We hope our journey can inspire others to see that relationships—whether they change or end—aren’t failures. We’ll keep sharing snippets of our lives as we navigate this new chapter. Love, Leah & Angelo," the post concluded. Remini and Pagán first met at a club in Los Angeles. (Getty Images) Remini and Pagán tied the knot in 2003 after they met at a Cuban club, El Floridita, in Los Angeles, where Pagán was performing in 1996. Their announcement comes a week after longtime friend Jennifer Lopez additionally filed for divorce from Ben Affleck. In May, Remini and Lopez reconnected after having a falling-out in 2022 over Affleck, according to Page Six . The "King of Queens" actress warned Lopez to remember the reason she originally broke up with Affleck when they first dated in 2002: "Because he is selfish and is not fully committed as a partner," a source said at the time. Remini and Pagan's announcement comes a week after longtime friend Jennifer Lopez additionally filed for divorce from Ben Affleck. CLICK HERE TO GET THE FOX NEWS APP Remini did not attend Lopez and Affleck’s second wedding ceremony in Georgia.Reps for Remini and Pagán did not immediately respond to Fox News Digital’s request for comment.

author: Emmanuel Camarillo
title: Person of interest in custody in attack against 2 Jewish students at DePaul University
text:
Person of interest in custody in attack against 2 Jewish students at DePaul University
Chicago police did not provide additional details about the arrest. The attack happened on Nov. 6 outside the DePaul student center in the 2200 block of North Sheffield Avenue in Lincoln Park.
A person of interest is in custody in an attack last November against two Jewish students at DePaul University.
Chicago police did not provide additional details about the arrest. The attack happened on Nov. 6 outside the DePaul student center in the 2200 block of North Sheffield Avenue in Lincoln Park.
Max Long and Michael Kaminsky were outside the student center when they were approached and attacked by two men wearing black face masks, according to Chicago police. The incident was being investigated as a hate crime.
Long and Kaminsky filed a lawsuit against DePaul earlier this month, alleging the university was negligent and failed to protect their safety while on campus.
Long suffered a concussion, and Kaminsky fractured his wrist during the attack, the complaint says. A DePaul Public Safety officer was also present but failed to intervene, according to the lawsuit.
“Jewish students should feel safe on their own campus,” Kaminsky said at a news conference announcing the suit. “When universities infringe upon these rights, accountability must be demanded.”
The university has condemned the attack, saying “such an act clearly defies DePaul’s values to uphold and care for the dignity of every individual.”
The attack took place several months after pro-Palestinian students erected an encampment on DePaul’s campus, following a national trend that saw students call for an end to the Israeli bombardment of Gaza in the wake of the Oct. 7, 2023, Hamas attacks in Israel.
The Trump administration has targeted students who had been involved with pro-Palestinian activism or speech, with a few high-profile detentions of students including Mahmoud Khalil, a green card holder who was a leader of protests at Columbia University in New York.
But schools are also seeing visas stripped from students with no known connection to protests. In some cases, past infractions such as traffic violations have been cited. Some colleges say the reasons remain unclear to them — and they are seeking answers.
Illinois Democrats await decisions from Durbin, Pritzker that will spark high-stakes political shuffle

author: Asmir Kovacevic
title: PlayStation announced Forza Horizon 5 release date
text:
Forza Horizon 5 is one more Xbox exclusive that will soon find its way on the rival PlayStation console. The official release date has been revealed, and it is April 25, 2025.
When Forza Horizon 5 was announced for PlayStation 5 in January, player reactions were quite mixed. Fans of great games welcomed the news, seeing it as a step toward ending the pointless console war. Meanwhile, die-hard Xbox and PlayStation loyalists were furious that "their exclusives" were making their way to other platforms.
Following the cross-platform releases of Hi-Fi Rush, Crash Bandicoot, and several other former exclusives—along with the announcement that Bethesda’s upcoming Doom: Dark Ages will launch on PlayStation 5—the confirmation of Forza Horizon 5 further reinforces the hope that the landscape of console exclusivity is changing for the better.
Today, the official announcement came in the form of a trailer on PlayStation's official YouTube channel, revealing Forza Horizon 5 along with its release date: April 25, 2025.
The official trailer description reads: "Dive into Horizon Realms! Explore 12 Evolving Worlds: 11 previously limited-time only locations and the completely new Horizon Stadium Circuit."
The PlayStation 5 version of Forza Horizon will have some specialties as well, as it is announced. The game will feature PlayStation trophies, in-game badges, and accolades. As it is said, for the first time ever, earning accolades will reward us with various cars, which we'll be able to use later in the game.
Also, the description says that we will be able to play the game solo and with friends from all the platforms, meaning Forza Horizon 5 will probably support the cross-play option.
Forza Horizon 5 was originally released back in 2021 for Xbox Series X|S, Xbox One, and PC and was one of the best-rated racing games ever by players and critics alike.
DON'T MISS!

author: TOI Tech Desk
title: How Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang's one sentence wiped out $8 billion in market cap of quantum computing compa
text:
How Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang's one sentence wiped out $8 billion in market cap of quantum computing companies
[Nvidia CEO](https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/topic/Nvidia-CEO)Jensen Huang’s single comment about the future of
[quantum computing](https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/topic/quantum-computing)triggered a massive selloff on Wednesday (January 8), wiping out approximately $8 billion in market value from quantum computing companies.
Major quantum computing players bore the brunt of the selloff.
[IonQ](https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/topic/IonQ)shares plummeted more than 40%, while Rigetti Computing crashed by over 45%.
[D-Wave](https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/topic/D-Wave)saw its shares sink 36%, though the stock remains up about 600% over the past year.
During Nvidia's analyst day at CES, Huang said getting "very useful quantum computers" to market could take 15 to 30 years. He told analysts that quantum computers would need 1 million times the number of
[quantum processing units](https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/topic/quantum-processing-units), called qubits, that they currently have.
Nvidia CEO is “dead wrong”
"He's dead wrong," fired back D-Wave Quantum CEO Alan Baratz. "The reason he's wrong is that we at D-Wave are commercial today," Baratz told CNBC, citing major clients like Mastercard and NTT Docomo that are "using our quantum computers today in production to benefit their business operations."Baratz acknowledged that while Huang's "comments may not be totally off-base for gate model quantum computers," they are "100% off base for annealing quantum computers" – the technology D-Wave uses. He offered to meet Huang "any time, any place" to help fill in these knowledge gaps.
The quantum computing sector had seen increased attention following Google's December announcement of its Willow
[quantum chip](https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/topic/quantum-chip)breakthrough.

author: Par Journal L'Union
title: Rallye-raid. Sainz et Brabec remportent le Dakar-2024
text: Rallye-raid. Sainz et Brabec remportent le Dakar-2024 La 46e édition du Dakar est revenue à l’Espagnol Carlos Sainz en auto et à l’Américain Ricky Brabec à moto. Dans ces deux catégories, les Français Sébastien Loeb et Adrien van Beveren sont montés sur la troisième marche du podium saoudien. Le pilote automobile espagnol Carlos Sainz (Audi) a coiffé sa quatrième couronne dans le [Dakar](https://www.dakar.com/fr), vendredi, au terme d’une 12e et dernière étape à Yanbu (Arabie Saoudite) qui a vu le deuxième sacre du motard américain Ricky Brabec (Honda). Vainqueur le plus âgé dans cette épreuve, le Castillan de 61 ans ajoute ce titre à ceux de 2010 (Volkswagen), 2018 (Peugeot) et 2020 (Mini). Il devance à finalement de plus d’une heure le Belge Guillaume de Mevius (Toyota) et le Français Sébastien Loeb (Prodrive). À l’arrivée, celui qui offre au passage son premier triomphe à Audi a sauté dans les bras de son fils, le pilote de Formule 1 Carlos Sainz Jr. En tête depuis la fin de la 6e étape, une course sur deux jours dans le désert de l’Empty Quarter, le double champion du monde des rallyes WRC (1990, 1992) a géré son avance durant toute la deuxième semaine grâce à ses coéquipiers suédois Mattias Ekström et français Stéphane Peterhansel. « Je suis très fier, merci à toute l’équipe, Stéphane, Mattias. C’est fantastique, les deux dernières semaines ont été tellement intenses. Sur cette route, on doute tout le temps mais, à la fin, le travail paie toujours », a déclaré « El Matador », drapeau de l’Espagne autour du cou. De Mevius : « Je vais la garder, cette moustache, elle m’a porté chance » S’il a de nouveau échoué dans sa quête du Dakar, Loeb, trois fois 2e (2017, 2022, 2023), aura joué des coudes avec Sainz jusqu’à la 11e étape, jeudi. Ses problèmes mécaniques l’auront privé, une nouvelle fois, du succès dans le mythique rallye-raid, son « objectif principal » désormais. « Nous avons essayé de nous battre pour la victoire mais Audi avait une super voiture, une équipe solide et ils se sont bien entraidés, ils avaient une super stratégie. (…) Hier (jeudi), je pensais abandonner. Finalement, nous sommes sur le podium, nous n’allons pas nous plaindre », a réagi à chaud l’Alsacien de 49 ans. Le nonuple champion WRC, dont c’était la huitième participation au Dakar, finit tout de même avec cinq étapes – dont l’ultime – à son actif. La surprise de cette édition s’appelle De Mevius, tout juste débarqué en T1+ après une 3e place en T3 (prototype léger) en 2023. « C’est un truc de fou ! Je vais devoir prendre le temps de digérer. J’ai grandi en regardant Loeb et Sainz à la télévision lorsqu’ils roulaient en WRC. Je vais la garder, cette moustache, elle m’a porté chance ! », dixit le Namurois de 29 ans. La « 48H Chrono » (6e étape) a été fatale à bon nombre de favoris, à l’image du Qatari Nasser Al-Attiyah (Prodrive), détenteur du trophée, qui allait jeter l’éponge trois jours plus tard, du Saoudien Yazeed Al-Rajhi (Toyota) ou encore de Peterhansel. « Monsieur Dakar » a toutefois décroché sa 50e victoire d’étape en auto, égalant le record du Finlandais Ari Vatanen, et affiche au total 83 succès en ajoutant ses 33 conquis à moto. Van Beveren enfin dans le Top 3 Dans cette catégorie, justement, les prétendants étaient plus nombreux cette année, avec trois Honda et une Hero. Brabec, déjà victorieux en 2020, a tiré son épingle du jeu, profitant de sa régularité tout au long du parcours. Le Californien de 32 ans devait ravir la première position au général à son coéquipier chilien Pablo Quintanilla à l’issue de la 6e étape et ne plus la quitter, étant parfois talonné de quelques secondes par le Botswanais Ross Branch. Il a fini par creuser l’écart à la faveur de bonnes navigations sur des pistes délicates. Gros coup de la part de l’écurie rouge Honda, qui place également la machine du Français Adrien van Beveren dans le Top 3. Le Nordiste de 33 ans, qui a fait d’un couronnement sur le Dakar son rêve ultime, s’est adjugé deux étapes, en particulier la 48H Chrono dans les dunes de Rub al-Khali, son terrain de jeu préféré. Très ému au moment du dénouement, le triple lauréat de l'Enduropale du Touquet (2014, 2015, 2016) a apprécié d’être « enfin monté sur le podium », le « fruit de (s)on travail ».

author: Emma Andrews
title: Para-paddlers propel for podium
text: To move a waka forward you pull with your arms and push with your legs, but for some it's a little bit trickier." /
